magpie.data.utilities.filters

Class MultiFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.data.utilities.filters.BaseDatasetFilter
      • magpie.data.utilities.filters.MultiFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Options

    public class MultiFilter
extends BaseDatasetFilter
    Filter that incorporates multiple other filters. User supplies multiple filters, which are processed sequentially. For each filter:
    1. Any entries that did not pass previous filter are ignored
    2. Label operation is calculated to determine which (of the remaining) entries pass this filter
    3. If the filter is set to exclude those entries, each result from 1 is logically negated
    4. For the entries that passed previous filter, results are updated

    Usage: -filter <include|exclude> <name> <options...> [-filter <...>]
    include|exclude: Whether to include or exclude entries that pass this filter
    name: Name of filtering method
    options: Options for that filter
    You can add as many filters as you want, just put "-filter" between each definition. Syntax is the same as for the first filter. Filters are executed sequentially.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
